programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around 2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the history of the ancient kingdom on a walk from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of Northumbria's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: How a well-preserved Viking ship discovered in 1904 continues to present archaeologists with new mysteries to unravel.

programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The murder in 1943 of businessman Sir Harry Oakes in the Bahamas, where the Duke of Windsor was governor at the time, and implicated in influencing the outcome of his murder trial.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution

programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At South Devon, engineer Ray Lee is working to bring a loco back in to service. There is also a visit to the SS Kingswear paddle steamer In Dartmouth, the oldest vessel of its kind.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: First in a two-part drama, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. The youngster soon makes friends with a local girl and the future looks rosy - but heartbreak is waiting just around the corner. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part drama based on the novel by Catherine Cookson, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The amateur sleuth is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers while holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London - a case involving a cleric whose disappearance is seemingly linked to an Irish train robbery. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Caroline Blakiston and Joan Greenwood.

programme.title: The Casual Vacancy
programme.desc: Tensions rise in Pagford as the parish council election approaches and each side steps up its campaign, with the fate of Sweetlove House hanging in the balance. Meanwhile, Miles pines for a quiet life and promises Samantha that once the vote is over everything will calm down, but she doesn't believe him, and Howard's dark secret is revealed in the Ghost's final post. Krystal returns home to find Terri back to her old ways, Hope seems more fragile than ever and news of a tragedy leaves the whole community reeling.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: The NLF want to make a trade. Alison watches over Ed, feeling conflicted over their marriage. Yusra smuggles a coded message to Armstrong, and Joe goes against his orders.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. Meanwhile, unrest growing in Burgundy spills over into an English battle. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The daughter of a man held responsible for a fatal boating accident on the Thames comes forward with new evidence, claiming that a property developer sabotaged the vessel. The case means putting Strickland's wealthy sailing friends under the spotlight, much to the team's delight. Guest starring Barbara Flynn (Cranford).

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits one of the National Gardens Scheme participants, Clearbeck House in Lancashire, where beautiful sculptures blend with the flowers and wildlife.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy Garvey is awarded his medal at Buckingham Palace, and an old flame returns into Major James McCudden's life. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The men take part in a training exercise in dealing with chemical weapons, and the arrival of a new soldier in the regiment brings trouble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani is convinced someone at the station was responsible for the hoax call to her ex-boyfriend, but Roger is sceptical and begins to worry about her state of mind. Lance and Sheelagh's drugs investigation on the Cole Lane Estate takes an ugly turn when an elderly man is attacked and suspicion falls on two local dealers - one of whom is subsequently shot dead. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy is assaulted by a friend of his first victim and responds by making a chilling phone call to Samantha.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The VRSA infection spreads rapidly around the hospital, and when Chrissie stumbles onto the source of the outbreak, Michael resorts to desperate measures, destroying hospital records and attempting to make her a scapegoat. Zubin leaves Paris's funeral to answer an emergency call, and Jess decides their relationship has no future if he keeps putting his job first. Devastated by her rejection, he decides to leave Holby for good.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's life hangs in the balance as staff struggle to diagnose her condition. Two sisters squabble over their father's estate and a fisherman experiences bizarre hallucinations. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mickey Webb, now working with the National Crime Squad, returns to Sun Hill and tells Jack he suspects Neil has ensured the silence of a key witness in a major money laundering trial. Alan Kennedy sets a trap for Samantha, luring her to a deserted warehouse and holding her at knifepoint, while Ramani's suspicions about Margaret grow after a witness statement goes missing.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat learns she is to appear at the Crown Court, while Sam goes back to live with her mum.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The guilt over lying to his family about his affair with Mrs Hewitt takes its toll on Arthur, while Pete has to make a big decision about his relationship with Rose.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Kevin gets trapped in a shop that has collapsed under the weight of scaffolding. He calls Nick, who has already arrived at the scene and is trying to rescue people from the rubble.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Shocked at the waste in the Glenbogle house, from six-course breakfasts to separate rooms for the dogs, Stella embarks on a money-saving mission. As things start to fall apart and the staff picket the estate, Archie decides to back his friends, refusing to buckle under the new regime. Alexandra Gilbreath and Alastair Mackenzie star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Charlie summons Jim back to Jersey to investigate the mysterious disappearance of a business associate's wife. Initial investigations reveal a lack of fidelity on the woman's part, that could involve colluding with one of Charlie's commercial rivals. Drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The family dog is accused of biting a girl, Billy tries to make Julie jealous, and Jack gets a bumper wage packet.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Peggy's penfriend comes to stay, but some of the staff are not convinced his intentions are entirely honourable. Comedy, starring Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but the tense atmosphere between them does not prevent a visit from her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Nobody Messes with Tony the Throat
programme.desc: Hobbo, Alvin and Entwistle set out to save the day when Howard suspects Pearl is seeing someone else and the trio soon draw up a surveillance operation that leads them to a seedy bikers' club. Toby sets out to find Aunty Wainwright when he has ironing problems.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Convicted murderer Charlie Walker seizes his chance to escape while in transit across the moors. The next morning a barmaid is discovered dead - leaving the duo to figure out whether she was killed by the fugitive. Tim Healy and Lynda Bellingham guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens a case originally worked on by a corrupt colleague of Sandra's father, leading the detective to seek the truth about her family's shady past - a decision that puts pressure on the relationship with her mother. Brian investigates a suspicious death at a brewery, while Gerry and Jack take the time to sample its wares.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.sub-title: In the Sight of the Lord: Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Cold Case squad investigate a murder dating back to World War Two. In 1948, a former conscientious objector was found killed with a nine-inch nail driven into his head. New evidence suggests he may have been the victim of a state-sponsored execution, but the case becomes more complicated. Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star.

programme.desc: Joy plans a party for the girls while the men are on their training exercise at the Army training ground. Meanwhile, Dave Tucker opens up about feeling depressed.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: In the final episode, the fusiliers attend the funeral of Tony Wilton. Elsewhere, Donna decides that it is time to move out.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Chrissie attempts to expose the cover-up before she is blamed for the VRSA outbreak and Darwin ward is closed down for good. At the disciplinary hearing, Mubbs is quite happy to let Dean take the blame for their recent mistakes - but when he learns of the consequences, his conscience pricks him.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A man struggles to come to terms with his wife's serious illness, while a frightened prisoner causes a stir and Penny performs a rare life-saving technique in a bid to help a baby with breathing difficulties. Lynda Bellingham guest stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Neil's world begins to collapse around his ears when his meeting with a key witness in the money laundering trial is followed by her attempted kidnapping. Already paranoid after discovering a bug in his house and an intruder rummaging through his rubbish, the confused copper begins to wonder if somebody's trying to frame him - and his suspicions are confirmed when he's beaten up, drugged and awakes to find himself next to a murdered man.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mandy persuades Aden to ditch his football practice and spend time with her, which has consequences. Ricky struggles to cope with losing Sam and turn to his friends for advice.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy's business venture gets off to a bad start, while Michelle's friend at college wants to share more than just his homework.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sally passes her initiation to become a member of Blue Watch, while Billy enters the boxing ring for a match against a tough opponent.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie's plans for a money-making fishing weekend are scuppered by Stella, who accuses Golly, Hector and Kilwillie of poaching fish. The 'Glenbogle Three' are arrested as a result, and Molly's legal abilities are put to the test as she defends them in court. Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers, Alastair MacKenzie and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim unwittingly finds himself caught up in a drug operation while babysitting a pair of difficult girls in the South of France. Drama, starring John Nettles, Therese Liotard and Pippa Guard.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline has good news about Oswald's sperm count, and Joey's loyalty to the family drives a wedge between him and Roxy.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: A wave of graffiti becomes a problem in Maplin's, so the staff goes in search of the culprit. Barry injures his back while trying to clean up, leading Yvonne to call on an old dancing partner to help out, while Fred learns new things about himself. Starring Simon Cadell and Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel is concerned that he has no pension plans, so the ever-resourceful Alistair comes up with an ingenious idea - to sell the country house. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will Stella Find True Love with Norris Fairburn?
programme.desc: After suffering a brush with Stella, Hobbo comes to the conclusion that it is time to find her a man - and, with the help of Clegg and Truly, he decides that eligible village heart-throb Norris Fairburn is the right match. Pearl's new-found passion for motorcycling causes trouble for Howard and Marina.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Sir Ian Rochester is infuriated when an interesting case is handed to Deed by new presider Sir Monty Everard, and takes his anger out on Jo. She is forced to cut her ties with John after she is brought before a disciplinary committee on trumped-up charges.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a man originally thought to have been killed by his hypnotised wife. Brian confronts the magician named in a tip-off and becomes embroiled in a battle of wits, while Gerry, sceptical of the phenomenon, agrees to be put under the spell of an expert at the Magic Circle - with disturbing results. Sam Kelly ('Allo! 'Allo!) guest stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. An abandoned car belonging to a former Home Secretary is discovered in a Belfast garage, containing a skeleton and an unexploded bomb. Although the garage owner, missing since 1981, may have had links to the IRA, a more disturbing theory soon emerges. Timothy West and Frances de la Tour guest star.

programme.desc: Ric confronts his own prejudices and the loss of Paris. Matt finally proves he has a bedside manner and Dean learns a valuable lesson shadowing Diane. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The staff come under suspicion as Duffy discovers drugs are missing and sets about trying to find the culprit. Meanwhile, two children have an emotional reunion with their family. Medical drama, starring Cathy Shipton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Neil is hauled into custody on a murder charge, mutual mistrust begins to brew between the Sun Hill regulars and the National Crime Squad team led by Mickey Webb. programme.desc: Rose discovers her secret fling with Pete is no longer a secret. Gita arrives and gives Sanjay a hard time, while Pauline gives Pat a pep talk.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gita discovers Sanjay's secret, which threatens to ruin their marriage. Michelle becomes annoyed after Jack arrives in Walford.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: As Blue Watch are putting out a small fire, young joyriders chased by the police crash into a tanker and cause a huge blaze at a petrol station.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Duncan's romantic hopes are crushed when Golly reveals Jessica is his daughter, and Alison has to tell her the truth before she finds out from someone else. Meanwhile, when Lexie gets an admirer, she is more than happy to use it to her advantage. Richard Briers, Alastair MacKenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Charlie helps a charity appeal for a war hero, while a newspaper advert lands Jim with a disreputable client, much to his regret. Crime drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack has hit the bottle and Freddie is torn between his loyal wife and the passionate Lilo Lill.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: A new season begins, but Jeffrey appears to have vanished. Classic comedy, starring Ruth Madoc and David Griffin.

programme.desc: Jean decides to go online, but Lionel is not so sure it is a good idea, and Judith's ex-boyfriend Alistair comes up against a big problem. Comedy about late-blossoming love, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will Randolph Make a Good Impression?
programme.desc: Hobbo's quest to find a man for Stella leads him to put up an advertisement, but the suitor who turns up lacks what it takes to tackle the widow and runs off. However, a chance to hit back emerges when Hobbo finds out who Stella's favourite movie character is.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Pilot of the crime drama series, starring Martin Shaw as the eponymous 1960s detective who despairs at the corruption he witnesses around him and resolves to find the gangster who killed his wife, before hanging up his truncheon. Paired with a headstrong officer, Gently struggles in solving an increasingly complex case while keeping his partner on the straight and narrow. With Phil Davis.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present the fourth and final day of the prestigious festival, including feature race the 3.30 Magners Cheltenham Gold Cup Steeple Chase, plus races at 1.30, 2.10, 2.50 and 4.10. With analysis from AP McCoy and Ruby Walsh, reports from Alice Plunkett, Brian Gleeson, Luke Harvey and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Matt Chapman, social stable thoughts from Oli Bell and Chris Hughes, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jimmy is surprised by what he learns, Samson comes clean to a shocked Vinny, and Andrea is given an idea on how to set up Kim.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff tries to persuade Yasmeen that Alya is out to get him, while Gary convinces Maria that he did nothing to provoke Ali and that the guy is a maniac. Audrey worries that Ken is being railroaded into moving to Stillwaters against his will, and Imran puts pressure on Toyah to find a new job.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. programme.desc: A masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for 400,000 after a fierce bidding war - and hours later, its former owner is tortured and killed. When a Hogson work is then stolen, Barnaby and Jones research the Midsomer painter with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms. They soon uncover evidence of forgery - but the killer is still at large. Guest starring David Bamber and Susannah Harker, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.desc: James Bond is assigned to investigate a notorious German gold smuggler and discovers his quarry has ambitions much greater than first suspected. Pursuing the criminal mastermind around the world, Bond uncovers the villain's audacious scheme to destroy the global economy with a daring attack on Fort Knox. Spy adventure, starring Sean Connery, Gert Frobe and Honor Blackman.

programme.desc: Drama about the secrets and dishonour among the upper echelons of 19th-century London society, adapted by Julian Fellowes from his novel of the same name. programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actress travels across two of the most enigmatic countries in the Caribbean - Cuba and Haiti - to explore, uncover and share the hidden gems they have to offer. Joanna kicks off her adventure in a Havana boxing gym with one of Cuba's rising female boxing stars. She visits the stars of the cabaret at the National Hotel that pre-dates the revolution, and entertains the cigar workers while they roll cigars in their factory. She visits the small town of Hershey, built on the success of the sugar industry, and visits the tomb of Che Guevara before heading off to Hemingway's favourite beach.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
